answer:
It is safe for your child to receive the Tetanus, Diphtheria, Pertussis, Polio (Tdap-IPV) and measles, mumps, rubella, varicella (MMR-V ) vaccines on March 5 and  hepatitis A vaccine on March 6. Vaccines can cause some pain and anxiety for children of all ages; there are tips to make both days a more positive experience here.
Immunization Nurse
question: Our 5 year old is having his Kindergarten shots (Tdap-IPV & MMRV) on March 5. We're going to Mexico and our GP has offered to give him a Hep A vaccine on March 6. Is this ok?
